to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: fc installation?
body:
Hi, going to the speakupmodified.org site it still says 6 is the most
current release.  Where can I get the new version of fedora core 7 with
speakup?  It would also be a great idea if you could make the CD and DVD
versions released on cheapbytes as even with a dsl modem it can take a
long time to download them.On Fri, 1 Jun 2007, Janina Sajka wrote:

> Littlefield, Tyler writes:
> > I've got an fc6 install disk here.
>
> Lose it and instead get Fedora 7 released yesterday.
>
> > Do I need all I think it was... 6?
>
> Huh?
>
> > Also, I seen in the docs where I could type linux text telnet.
>
> Consult my guidance at:
>
> https://www.redhat.com/archives/blinux-list/2005-August/msg00038.html
>
> one mistake in that doc is that the correct way to specify your ethernet
> device is something like:
>
> ksdevice=eth0
>
> Or better still by mac address something like:
>
> ksdevice=aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff
>
> > Can I specify an IP address to? or does it just assign a random IP from the dhcp server.
>
> Consult the above referenced.
>
> Janina
>
>
> _______________________________________________
> Speakup mailing list
> Speakup@braille.uwo.ca
> http://speech.braille.uwo.ca/mailman/listinfo/speakup
>
